posts.post_content:
[Zealous Inquisitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zealous Inquisitor), Boros edition.  
  
The first strike option doesn't quite synergize with his triggered ability.  
But it's an advantage nonetheless - especially if you're facing other first strikers, or want him to survive a combat.  
  
Overall a really efficient creature, and also one your opponent definitely doesn't want to try their burn spells on.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Currently the fifth-best minotaur on Gatherer, with [Lord of Shatterskull Pass](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of Shatterskull Pass) holding the coveted top rank.   
  
I posit that our friend the reckoner here is better, as he requires a lot less support to be good. The lord requires such an investment of mana that you really need to protect him if you want to rely on his effect, whereas Monsieur Reckoner immediately has an impact, and most of the time he really hurts your opponent by dying.   
  
I can see why Tanhgarth still outranks him, though.
posts.html:

The lord requires such an investment of mana that you really need to protect him if you want to rely on his effect, whereas Monsieur Reckoner immediately has an impact, and most of the time he really hurts your opponent by dying.

I can see why Tanhgarth still outranks him, though.

posts.post_content:
@Yozuck: It's perfect with him, though. You have the ability to save him by utilizing first strike if you want, or you can just let him eat the damage to then redirect it somewhere else. I figured that was relatively straight-forward.  
  
But, yeah, as has been said, Reckoner + [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm) + [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova) + [Vizkopa Guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vizkopa Guildmage) is the unlimited combo in this current set. Not the most reliable unlimited combo because there are so many cards involved, but still doable and each of these cards even without the rest is good on it's own.

posts.post_content:
Everyone sees a great card. It is.  
  
Some people see an almost strictly better [Spitemare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spitemare) (the mare is more splashable)... I see a mana curve.  
  
Turn 2, [Mogg Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mogg Maniac). Turn 3, this. Turn 4, Spitemare. Turn 5, [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll).  
  
This is the casual deck of doom. Throw in a few fun cards like [Blood Lust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Lust) or [Blood Frenzy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Frenzy) (to play on your opponent's creatures, if they attack / block, or on yours if they aren't blocked - or even to screw up two opponents in multi-player), the always useful [Brute Force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brute Force), board sweepers like [Earthquake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Earthquake) (or [Starstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Starstorm) if you need help with fliers), the already mentioned [Blasphemous Act](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blasphemous Act) as win-more...  
  
And the killer combo that was born back when the Mogg was the only creature we had that did this: add a couple of [Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath) and [Reckless Abandon/autocar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reckless Abandon/autocar)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Everyone sees a great card. It is.

Some people see an almost strictly better Spitemare (the mare is more splashable)... I see a mana curve.

Turn 2, Mogg Maniac. Turn 3, this. Turn 4, Spitemare. Turn 5, Stuffy Doll.

This is the casual deck of doom. Throw in a few fun cards like Blood Lust or Blood Frenzy (to play on your opponent's creatures, if they attack / block, or on yours if they aren't blocked - or even to screw up two opponents in multi-player), the always useful Brute Force, board sweepers like Earthquake (or Starstorm if you need help with fliers), the already mentioned Blasphemous Act as win-more...

And the killer combo that was born back when the Mogg was the only creature we had that did this: add a couple of Furnace of Rath and Reckless Abandon/autocar... (see all)

posts.post_content: I underestimated this guy soooo much when he was first spoiled. Now I'm sure he's a better Boros creature than [Frontline Medic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frontline Medic), and certainly harder to hate. My only complaint (and it's a tiny, little one) is that he doesn't fit very well into Boros Human decks that run off of [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls). But those decks have so many other tools, it's probably more fair that they miss out on one of the guild's best creatures ever.
posts.html:
